title: HW1 Q4
content: Problem context: This is an old exam problem that is there to make sure you understand the basics of Adam as well as the connection of weight-decay to regularization in the SGD context.
document:
Problem context: 

This is an old exam problem that is there to make sure you understand the basics of Adam as well as the connection of weight-decay to regularization in the SGD context.

comments.content: <document version="2.0"><paragraph>Technically, a part of this problem --- the part (a) about Adam --- is out of usual scope since it wasn't hit in last week's lecture. (We'll typically want HW released on Friday to have scope through the previous lecture.) <break/><break/>So don't feel bad about skipping this one if you are working on it before it showed up in lecture. </paragraph></document>
comments.document:
Technically, a part of this problem --- the part (a) about Adam --- is out of usual scope since it wasn't hit in last week's lecture. (We'll typically want HW released on Friday to have scope through the previous lecture.) 

So don't feel bad about skipping this one if you are working on it before it showed up in lecture.
